Curtain Lorimer creates new and innovative ideas. What does that mean?

## It means stuff like this.

<Card title="Here's a Minute" img="https://curtainlorimer.com/_astro/ham-radio.B3yZnW2y_Z1caIG2.webp" img_alt="Here's a Minute logo" link="/work/curtain-lorimer/heres-a-minute" />
<Card title="Some Music Makers" img="https://curtainlorimer.com/_astro/hamradio.CNahsPJ4_ZxJxab.webp" img_alt="Here's a Minute logo" link="/work/curtain-lorimer/some-music-makers" />

## Not everything is a solo project.

I'm only one person. And as much as I'd love to try to do everything, it's completely impossible to do everything. (Just working on this website is tiring!)

That's why I started this - because I want to try and bring that energy of "Let's do something weird, and cool, and whatever" to more people. 

Curtain Lorimer isn't a company. It's a little thing I'm using to incubate new ideas from like-minded people, where we all help each other build our projects.
Everyone brings something different to the table - but when we all team up, we can make truly amazing stuff happen.
Writer, host, and person responsible for all the behind-the-scenes work (like making the website, editing, etc.)

I thought it'd be fun to try a podcast again - so I decided to start one with a friend. ## Hosting + Writing Obviously, any podcast wouldn't be a podcast without a host (or two) to walk people through an audio presentation. That would be me! Vian and I come up with the prompts, and hopefully you'll listen too! ## Web Development As a freelance web developer, I used [Astro](https://astro.build) and [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com) to get these websites up and running for the holiday season (also known as: getting websites done within three days of notice.) ## Branding Simple and elegant. That's what I usually go with. At least for the album, I was in charge of making the album art. A stopwatch and bold text was how we wanted to make it work. Colours were chosen for the pop factor, and everything else was just whatever came to mind. And I think it looks great. ## Music Since the last time I had to compose music for a podcast, I've bettered myself as a musician. In terms of music direction, I've gone for an Animal Crossing-esque vibe with the instrumentation of a small jazz band. I'm not trying to make meditation music, but I'm also not trying to go too wild with the music. It'll be out on Spotify (soon). Take a look at the album of music I've composed specifically as backdrop music for this podcast - it's a lot!

I thought it’d be fun to try a podcast again - so I decided to start one with a friend.

Hosting + Writing

Obviously, any podcast wouldn’t be a podcast without a host (or two) to walk people through an audio presentation. That would be me! Vian and I come up with the prompts, and hopefully you’ll listen too!

Web Development

As a freelance web developer, I used Astro and Tailwind CSS to get these websites up and running for the holiday season (also known as: getting websites done within three days of notice.)

Branding

Simple and elegant. That’s what I usually go with.

At least for the album, I was in charge of making the album art. A stopwatch and bold text was how we wanted to make it work. Colours were chosen for the pop factor, and everything else was just whatever came to mind. And I think it looks great.

Music

Since the last time I had to compose music for a podcast, I’ve bettered myself as a musician.

In terms of music direction, I’ve gone for an Animal Crossing-esque vibe with the instrumentation of a small jazz band. I’m not trying to make meditation music, but I’m also not trying to go too wild with the music. It’ll be out on Spotify (soon).

Take a look at the album of music I’ve composed specifically as backdrop music for this podcast - it’s a lot!
I'm the business captain, responsible for public relations, social media, and other endeavors (like a website built using Astro.)

You probably wouldn’t expect a robotics team to have a place for a front-end developer, but I definitely found a place for one.

Accomplishments

    - Revamped a WordPress-based website to be approximately 25% more performant
    - Deployed an Astro-based documentation website completely cost-free
    - Helped establish new options for contributing to the team financially, like Zeffy and PayPal
    - Regularly contributed to fundraising efforts

WordPress

Our initial website started out with an outdated theme and a bunch of plugins weighing down the entire website. I took those out and started writing new policies for how to write stuff.

I still continue with these roles as the business captain, but under my previous tenure as the Public Relations, Social Media, and Website Manager (yeah, we were a little short-staffed and continue to be), I’m responsible for monthly blog posts and maintaining the website. Oh, and occasionally giving it a face lift.

Astro Development

As someone who tasked themselves with putting any and all relevant documentation regarding the website and the robot onto a resource easily accessible by anyone who needs it, I pushed myself to create an Astro-based website. It’s performant, simple to write for (so newer members can easily add stuff), and it taught me how to write websites (like the one you’re looking at) in Astro.

Granted, it’s not the best by any means. But it’s an easily readable website available for anyone to access.

Social Media and Promotion

Once again, it’s not the best - but it’s something. I’m in charge of our social media accounts - which means that all the funny videos and posts have me behind the scenes.

I’m also in charge of the digital signage we have. I manage it with AbleSign

Website
Co-writer, co-host, and person responsible for all the behind-the-scenes work (like making the website, editing, etc.)

My first bout at a podcast was ultimately a failure, but it taught me a lot of things. ## Achievements
    - It was a podcast!
    - Wrote theme and transition music
That's it. There's more to the story. ## Hosting + Writing I'd never written for a podcast before, and I'd also never hosted a podcast before. ## Web Development The website (since taken down) was a simple WordPress-based website based on Twenty Fifteen ## Branding Bold colours and a simple wordmark. Ultimately not my best design, but one that stood the test of time (and almost ended up becoming the inspiration for a soundtrack for a short film). ## Final Remarks Please don't use this as your basis of my portfolio. I've taken lessons from this little experiment and used it to write [Here's a Minute](http://lexwu.com/work/curtain-lorimer/heres-a-minute) with my friend Vian Vera. And I'm also significantly better as [a composer and producer now.](https://lwumusic.com)

My first bout at a podcast was ultimately a failure, but it taught me a lot of things.

Achievements

    - It was a podcast!
    - Wrote theme and transition music
That's it. There's more to the story.

Hosting + Writing

I’d never written for a podcast before, and I’d also never hosted a podcast before.

Web Development

The website (since taken down) was a simple WordPress-based website based on Twenty Fifteen

Branding

Bold colours and a simple wordmark. Ultimately not my best design, but one that stood the test of time (and almost ended up becoming the inspiration for a soundtrack for a short film).

Final Remarks

Please don’t use this as your basis of my portfolio. I’ve taken lessons from this little experiment and used it to write Here’s a Minute with my friend Vian Vera. And I’m also significantly better as a composer and producer now.
A co-writer, actor, and member of a scrappy short-film startup club at our school.
Movie Making Club members writing and planning a short film

Yep, that's us. (Photo by Skye Turrietta, by the way.) You're probably wondering how we got here. ## Achievements
    - Co-wrote the short film "Backstage" with two other writers - Co-wrote short film codenamed "Ghost Shenanigans" with another writer - Contributed to development of short film "Shoe" - Acted as an extra in each film
## Backstage As one of three writers, I contributed to scheduling everything out (even though we ended up going overtime - whoops!) Though I can't release the short film (it hasn't been released, and is not slated for public release), I can say it's some of the best work this club has ever done, and the closest we've got to actually releasing a film. ## Shoe This was the first film the club ever tried making. It focused on a janitor with anger management issues, and included someone dying falling down the stairs. (I’m butchering the summary in case any of us want to revive it.) We never released it (due to a bunch of factors, such as us not establishing a rigid filming schedule – but that’s not the point). I tried contributing music to this. Though it was never released (and therefore, nothing will ever be uttered about this topic henceforth), the spirit of Shoe lives on in my podcast [Here's a Minute](/curtain-lorimer/heres-a-minute), where the music lives on. The only thing you'll ever hear about this project is that we were slated to throw someone down the stairs. Participating in this short film was fun – even if we never got to finish it. The music was just something I tried on the side. I never really expected any of it to be selected for the final film. I'll attach the chess theme, but for more, [you should probably visit my music website!](https://lwumusic.com)

Achievements

Backstage

As one of three writers, I contributed to scheduling everything out (even though we ended up going overtime - whoops!) Though I can’t release the short film (it hasn’t been released, and is not slated for public release), I can say it’s some of the best work this club has ever done, and the closest we’ve got to actually releasing a film.

Shoe

This was the first film the club ever tried making. It focused on a janitor with anger management issues, and included someone dying falling down the stairs. (I’m butchering the summary in case any of us want to revive it.) We never released it (due to a bunch of factors, such as us not establishing a rigid filming schedule – but that’s not the point).

I tried contributing music to this. Though it was never released (and therefore, nothing will ever be uttered about this topic henceforth), the spirit of Shoe lives on in my podcast Here’s a Minute, where the music lives on.

The only thing you’ll ever hear about this project is that we were slated to throw someone down the stairs. Participating in this short film was fun – even if we never got to finish it.

The music was just something I tried on the side. I never really expected any of it to be selected for the final film. I’ll attach the chess theme, but for more, you should probably visit my music website!
